intro: Psychotria harmandiana, commonly known as the "Cocaine plant," is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and small, white flowers. The plant contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which are found in its leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also known for its historical and illicit use.
